TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 138
TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to James Whiteside, 11-02-1828

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to James Whiteside, November 2, 1828. Requesting a loan of $20.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 138

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to James Whiteside, November 2, 1828. Requesting a loan of $20.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Dr Sir,*/p*
*p*I am in a little pinch for twenty dollars to take up a note of *person_mentioned*Thos Slaughter*/person_mentioned*s that is in the hands of *person_mentioned*Richardson */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Davis*/person_mentioned*—I owe this Money to *person_mentioned*Slaughter */person_mentioned*for shingles for the *location_mentioned*house */location_mentioned*and have not got it by me— If it is possible you will very much oblige me by lending me that sum and paying it to *person_mentioned*Richardson */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Davis */person_mentioned*and taking up *person_mentioned*Slaughter*/person_mentioned*s note and giving it to him— I hope you will try and accomodate me for I am too much engaged in the *location_mentioned*office */location_mentioned*at this time to leave here and ride about through the *location_mentioned*Country */location_mentioned*to make collections*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="11-25-1828">Novr 25, 1828*/date_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Mr. James Whiteside*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
